entry.title: Crypto Game-Changer: Denmark To Introduce 1st Ever Unrealized Gains Tax
entry.summary:
Benjamin Franklin, a well-known American statesman, said: “Nothing is certain in this world except death and taxes.” It’s a remark that might now hold true to crypto, as Denmark plans to impose a new taxation policy that targets the unrealized capital gains of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin.
Denmark: Tax Reform For Crypto Assets
The Danish government is about to make a bold move of initiating a pioneering tax reform covering digital assets like Bitcoin.
It is considered as an unprecedented step as the cryptocurrency space has been subject of government regulations in many countries and the ongoing debate on implementing more government regulations and taxation on it.
According to the Danish government, tax authorities will start collecting a 42% tax on cryptocurrencies’ unrealized…

entry.title: Pennsylvania House Passes ‘Bitcoin Rights’ Bill With Bipartisan Support
entry.summary:
The Pennsylvania House of Representatives has made a significant move in the cryptocurrency regulation landscape in the US by passing the ‘Bitcoin Rights’ bill with “overwhelming” bipartisan support.
A Landmark Move For Bitcoin Rights
The bill, officially known as House Bill 2481, received a decisive vote of 176 to 26, with 76 Democrats and all 100 Republicans backing the measure.
The bill aims to protect the rights of individuals to self-custody their digital assets, affirm their ability to use Bitcoin for payments, and establish explicit guidelines for the taxation of Bitcoin transactions.
After the upcoming election, the bill will advance to the Republican-led Pennsylvania Senate, and if approved, it will be sent to Governor Josh Shapiro for final approval.
Crafted in col…

entry.title: Coinbase Named Official Partner of Canadian Football League
entry.summary:
Coinbase was named official partner of the Canadian Football League and the 111th Grey Cup, the crypto exchange announced today (Thursday). As part of the deal, Coinbase will sponsor the 111th Grey Cup and the highly anticipated coin toss during the November event in Vancouver. Bringing Crypto Closer to CFL Fans According to the top crypto exchange, this partnership targets the growing crypto adoption in Canada, where an estimated five million people, about 13% of the population, are reportedly involved in the crypto space. The CFL's partnership deal with Coinbase reportedly marks the first time a major Canadian sports league has officially entered the world of cryptocurrency. Commenting about the partnership, Lucas Matheson, the CEO of Coinbase Canada, said: “The CFL is one of Canada’s most celebrated sports leagues, and we’re thrilled to be partnering with them. Together, we aim to deepen Canadians’ connection with crypto and provide them with the tools and opportunities to participate in the digital economy, increasing economic freedom across Canada in the process.” Following the collaboration, the entities have invited CFL fans to take part in the crypto economy through Coinbase's promotional offers. Fans who make their first trade on the Coinbase app or website will reportedly receive $25 in Bitcoin as part of the kickoff to this partnership. Bitcoin Prizes Furthermore, fans scanning QR codes will have chances to win Bitcoin prizes, regular season tickets, or even a grand prize of $50,000 in Bitcoin and an all-inclusive trip to the 112th Grey Cup in 2024. The Grey Cup will feature additional fan engagement, including the Twisted Tea Grey Cup Halftime Show, headlined by the Jonas Brothers. With over 100 years of history, the Grey Cup is one of Canada's renowned annual events.
This article was written by Jared Kirui at www.financemagnates.com.

entry.title: CEO Brad Garlinghouse Says Ripple Made A Mistake With The SEC, Here’s Why
entry.summary:
In a recent interview, Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse admitted that the payments technology company should have done better with its relations with regulators in the United States in the early days of XRP. This comment was made in relation to the legal enforcement actions Ripple has been facing in the past few years.
Particularly, Garlinghouse noted that its failure to engage with regulators very early has seen Ripple and the crypto industry in general now “trying to make up for lost time to some degree.”
Ripple Lawsuits Could’ve Been Avoided
The Ripple-SEC case, which revolves around whether XRP is considered a security, has dragged on for years and has created uncertainty not just for XRP but for the entire crypto industry. Earlier this year, the lawsuit appeared to be nearing reso…

entry.title: Will Norway Go Digital? Central Bank To Decide On CBDC Next Year
entry.summary:
Next year, Norges Bank, Norway’s Central Bank, is going to make a major decision regarding the potential of establishing its own CBDC, or central bank digital currency.
According to Deputy Governor Pal Longva, the central bank was moving toward finalizing the recommendation, though it did not feel like the work had to be fast-tracked immediately.
Indeed, other European countries, like Switzerland, have been moving ahead on digital currency projects. Norway, on the other hand, will always take its time and move cautiously.
“We are in line with many central banks — we are studying complex issues and have much to consider before proceeding,” Longva said during an interview in Oslo.
He expressed how Norway hasn’t fallen behind in the game while Switzerland, for instan…

entry.summary: BTC hits 2-week high as China stocks rise. SUI breaks into the top 15 coins. $1.3bn ETH might be sold from PlusToken scam. S. Korea may approve BTC & ETH ETFs this month. Australia launches first ETH ETF. Samara to buy BTC with $33m bond. Altcoins to see $500m unlocks this week. Vitalik writes blog on the future of ETH. Grayscale reveals 35 altcoins considered for funds. Ethena proposes SOL for USDe collateral. Only one Binance launchpad coin up this year. AVAX summit begins this week.

entry.title: Todd ‘revealed’ as Satoshi, Google may be Broken-up, Murad’s Wallets Doxxed
entry.summary: BTC will be range bound until election: Bernstein. TAO & memecoins dominate mindshare. Peter Todd ‘revealed’ as Satoshi by HBO. US government able to sell $4.4bn Silk Road BTC. Ireland unable to access $378m seized BTC. SOL could do 5x if Trump wins: StanChart. Coinbase integrates Taproot addresses for BTC. Canary Capital applies for XRP ETF. S. Korea to regulate stablecoin transfers. CryptoCom files countersuit against SEC. Babylon fills cap with 22k BTC. Scroll airdrop coming Oct 22nd. USDC goes live on SUI.

entry.title: Crypto Falls Ahead of CPI, Stripe Reinstates Crypto, Fed Charges Market-makers
entry.summary: Majors drop despite stocks hitting ATHs. Stripe reinstates crypto payments. Crypto settlements near $20bn in 2024. S. Korea to review ban on BTC ETFs. US charges market makers for market manipulation. FBI created their own coin to ensnare targets. Vitalik ‘outside pick’ for Nobel Prize. Trump family token to built on Aave stack. $16m OP tokens allocated to superchain users. Wisdomtree debuts debit card for on-chain fund. 47% of hedge funds have crypto exposure. Argentina overtakes Brazil for crypto inflows. Tucker interviews Ryan Salame over FTX.

entry.title: Bitcoin Bounces from $59K, Tesla unveils Robotaxis, Memecoins Outperform
entry.summary: BTC briefly dips under $59k, $160m liquidations. Mt Gox extends repayment plan by 1 year. Uniswap plans L2 for DeFi. SEC sues crypto trading firm Cumberland. Binomial sues SEC over futures trading. SEC’s Uyeda criticises agency’s policy. Justin Sun named prime minister of Liberland. MicroStrategy wants to become BTC bank. Binance pre-market trading goes live. Nearly 50% of US investors want crypto ETFs. Whale phished for $35m crypto. Ethena invests $46m in RWA funds. Trump’s crypto project aims to raise $300m.

entry.title: Decentraland Desktop Client Preview
entry.summary: Ethereum metaverse game Decentraland has shared an exclusive look at the visual and performance upgrades coming via its new desktop client.

entry.title: Crypto Trader Murad Mahmudov talks about the Supercycle and how he chooses Meme Coins.
entry.summary: Crypto Trader Murad Mahmudov talks about the Supercycle and how he chooses Meme Coins. Crypto stable, had sold off after China stocks fall. Crypto adopted faster than other tech: BlackRock. Crypto adoption to hit 8% of world population. CryptoCom recieves Wells notice from SEC. HBO documentary on Satoshi airs tonight. FTX bankruptcy plan approved by judge. Scroll airdrop may be imminent. Jupiter goes live on mobile iOS. Phantom rolls out support for Base. AAVE launches GHO on Base. Gensler may be replaced by Robinhood CLO. 87% of new token launches on SOL. National Bank of Bahrain creates BTC fund. BedRock DeFi allows BTC staking on ARB.

entry.title: Memecoins take off, funding stays low, China stocks keep on rising!
entry.summary: FOMO HOUR EP213. Memecoins take off, funding stays low, China stocks keep on rising! Many altcoins & memecoins soar despite stable BTC. Funding rates continue to be low or negative. Crypto funds saw $147m of outflows last week. BTC remains best performing major assets this year. SUI breaks into the top 20 coins again. TAO leads top 100 away from memes, sifu shorts. $100m bridge to SOL over the last 7 days. Metaplanet buys $6.7m more BTC. ETH proposal aims to improve throughput 50%. EIGEN, OP, APT lead token unlocks this week.

entry.title: How Walrus Protocol Unlocks New Applications for Decentralized Data Storage
entry.summary: Mysten Labs Chief Scientist George Danezis joined Decrypt to talk about its new decentralized storage protocol Walrus, which promises to unlock new applications such as AI and social media, thanks to its novel Red Stuff data encoding algorithm.

entry.title: Why Coinbase Sees Crypto as a Bipartisan, 'Purple' Political Issue
entry.summary: Coinbase VP of Corporate and Business Development, Shan Aggarwal, joined Decrypt's Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano at Messari Mainnet 2024 to discuss the exchange's efforts to grow mainstream crypto adoption—and how the changing political conversation around digital assets is rapidly playing a major role in that.

entry.title: Binance Is Playing Offense—Not Just Defense—Against Crypto Crime, Says Head of Financial Investigations
entry.summary: Nils Anderson Röed, the exchange’s global head of financial investigations, sat down with Decrypt’s Sander Lutz at Messari Mainnet 2024 to discuss how Binance is proactively dismantling criminal networks around the world, the strategy with which the crypto exchange is approaching sensitive conflicts in the Middle East, and more.
